meanings.definition: To be overcome by a large amount or intensity of something.
meanings.sent1: She felt overwhelmed by the number of tasks on her to-do list.
meanings.sent2: The students were overwhelmed with joy when they received their exam results.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked overwhelmed by the pile of toys scattered around the room.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset overwhelmed her senses, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the roaring waterfall overwhelmed their ears, drowning out all other noise.

meanings.definition: To have a strong emotional effect on someone.
meanings.sent1: The touching movie scene overwhelmed her with tears.
meanings.sent2: The surprise party overwhelmed him with happiness.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compliment overwhelmed her with gratitude.
meanings.sent4: The tragic news overwhelmed them with sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop overwhelmed him with awe.

meanings.sent1: The army overwhelmed the enemy forces in a swift victory.
meanings.sent2: The champion boxer overwhelmed his opponent in the final round.
meanings.sent3: The clever strategy overwhelmed the rival team, securing the win.
meanings.sent4: The powerful storm overwhelmed the fragile dam, causing it to break.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat overwhelmed the ice cream, turning it into a puddle.
